SEARCH
Module org.postgresql.pljava
Package org.postgresql.pljava.model

Interface Trigger

All Superinterfaces:
CatalogObject, CatalogObject.Addressed<Trigger>, CatalogObject.Named<Lexicals.Identifier.Simple>
public interface Trigger extends CatalogObject.Addressed<Trigger>, CatalogObject.Named<Lexicals.Identifier.Simple>
Model of a trigger entry in the PostgreSQL catalogs.

This catalog object, at least at first, will have an unusual limitation: its accessor methods (other than those of CatalogObject.Addressed) may only work when called by a trigger function or its language handler within the scope of the function's specialization and execution. Some may be unimplemented even then, as noted in the documentation of the methods themselves.

  • Field Details

    • CLASSID

      static final RegClass.Known<Trigger> CLASSID

  • Method Details

    • name

      Lexicals.Identifier.Simple name()
      Name of this trigger.

      The table on which the trigger is declared serves as a namespace, within which trigger names on the same table must be unique.

      Specified by:
      name in interface CatalogObject.Named<Lexicals.Identifier.Simple>

    • relation

      RegClass relation()
      The table on which this trigger is declared.

      May throw UnsupportedOperationException. Within a trigger function or its handler, RegProcedure.Call.Context.TriggerData can supply the same information.

    • parent

      Trigger parent()
      Parent trigger this trigger is cloned from (applies to partitioned tables), null if not a clone.

      May throw UnsupportedOperationException.

      See Also:
      • isClone()

    • function

      RegProcedure<Trigger.ForTrigger> function()
      The function to be called.

      May throw UnsupportedOperationException. Within a trigger function or its handler, this is just the function being called.

    • called

      Trigger.Called called()
      When this trigger is to fire (before, after, or instead of the triggering event).

    • events

      Set<Trigger.Event> events()
      The event(s) for which the trigger can fire.

    • scope

      Trigger.Scope scope()
      The scope (per-statement or per-row) of this trigger.

    • enabled

      Trigger.ReplicationRole enabled()
      For which session_replication_role modes the trigger fires.

    • internal

      boolean internal()
      True if the trigger is internally generated (usually to enforce the constraint identified by constraint()).

    • constraintRelation

      RegClass constraintRelation()
      The referenced table if this trigger pertains to a referential integrity constraint, otherwise null.

    • constraintIndex

      RegClass constraintIndex()
      The index supporting a unique, primary key, referential integrity, or exclusion constraint, null if this trigger is not for such a constraint.

    • constraint

      Constraint constraint()
      The constraint associated with the trigger, null if none.
      Returns:
      null, no Constraint catalog object is implemented yet

    • deferrable

      boolean deferrable()
      True for a constraint trigger that is deferrable.

    • initiallyDeferred

      boolean initiallyDeferred()
      True for a constraint trigger initially deferred.

    • columns

      TargetList.Projection columns()
      The columns of interest (as a TargetList.Projection of relation()'s columns) if the trigger is column-specific, otherwise null.

    • arguments

      List<String> arguments()
      Any additional String arguments to pass to the trigger function.

    • when

      SQLXML when()
      A pg_node_tree representation of a boolean expression restricting when this trigger can fire, or null if none.

    • tableOld

      Lexicals.Identifier.Simple tableOld()
      Name by which an ephemeral table showing prior row values can be queried via SPI by the function for an AFTER trigger whose events include UPDATE or DELETE.

    • tableNew

      Lexicals.Identifier.Simple tableNew()
      Name by which an ephemeral table showing new row values can be queried via SPI by the function for an AFTER trigger whose events include UPDATE or INSERT.

    • isClone

      boolean isClone()
      True if this trigger is a clone.

      This information will be available to a trigger function or its handler, even if the actual parent trigger is not.
